reviewText: Product received for free\n\nVery funny and cute puzzle game,fun to play but challenging. Sliding the map to guide dodos to the portal and save the poor birds. Sound and animations is good. For that price lot of fun. Recommended!

reviewText:
Seems I'm one of the first to review.

Save the Dodos is a puzzle game which revolves around sliding the map around to guide dodo birds into a doorway. It's that simple. Except it's not, because the difficultly will increase. And if your like me, you will have a tough time. The game will throw in other modes and enemies into play, along with powerup birds that can help beat a frustrating level.
I'm sure the devs will come out with some new content in the future, and that is my investment. You will get some good time off of this game.
voteText: 20 of 27 people (74%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Very nice game with juicy art, challenging puzzles and stupid as hell suicidal dodos running ever forward. Well this game is pretty fun to play, has nice OST and pretty cheap, all around good buy:

+Great visuals, colorfull and nicely drawn levels, nice animations
+Good OST and other sounds
+Pretty challenging, most of the levels i was swinging layers left and right and up and down hoping for the best (mostly because i'm not very smart) but it was fun as heck, specially when you actually win the level :)
+Plenty of the levels
+Super cheap +Steam cards = nearly free game :)
-No steam achievements, but there is achievements in the game, maybe they will attach them to steam aswell later.
-No proper settings for screen resolution and sound.

reviewText: Very interesting puzzle game.\nMain goal - to save the dodos from the certain death, but you can't control them - they are running forward, dying from savages, thorns and other dangers of this wild world. Also you cannot use some magical items to solve that puzzles. But there is a interesting way for doing this.\nThe game's screen splitted into a number of squire blocks, usually in 3x3 grid. Each block have some terrain" piece in it
date: and the lines of blocks are "circled":  if the dodo will run to the left it will appear from the right side
recommended: if the savage will fall down - it will continue his falling from the up.\nPlayer have ability to rotate this lines of blocks vertically or horisontally
hoursPlayed: changing landscape of the mission. Sounds simple
voteText: but some mission are quite challenging. I cleared only first word so far

reviewText: I expected something lemmings style. The mechanics is quite different, but equally funny.\nOn the only bad thing is on  my ubuntu 14.04.4 it destabilizes steam (I saved dodos, but eventually I had to kill -9" steam)"

Product received for free\n\nI like graphical style of this game. It is casual puzzle game, where you need move tiles to change playfield and help dodos get to exit portal or save dodos from hunters in some levels. Atractive game if you like puzzles. Nice timekiller.

It's not a bad game. It good graphics/art and a good concept and puzzle plot. But it's just not my style. Don't get me wrong I still say it's a pretty good game. I just can't see myself enjoying this game for hours or playing it when I'm bored. But thats just my opinion
